channel.title: Running a server on a VPS
channel.description:
So, recently i bought a vps for my 602 server, and i put it on it... the problem is, i downloaded java on my vps, set my environmental variables, and all, then i clicked runserver, and it said " 'Java' is not recognized as an internal or external command "... Can anyone tell me how to fix this? or atleast teamveiw me? Please help, i don't want to let 40 ppl online down :(
PLEASE HELP GUYS!

item.title: Running a server on a VPS
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Instead of:

java -Xmx256m server

or something like that, if you ever have java.exe in a different location, you would copy the link of the java.exe file and replace java with that, like for example, java on a USB:

“F:/Java/jre6/bin/java.exe” -Xmx256m server

Hope that helps.

Read full topic
item.source: Running a server on a VPS
